questions.question_text: Which command will permanently decommission a peer node operating in an indexer cluster?
Which CLI command converts a Splunk instance to a license slave?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Answer C

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Admin/LicenserCLIcommands

Answer C
As of today and according to the documentation, it would be 
splunk edit licenser-localpeer

https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/latest/Admin/LicenserCLIcommands

The correct is C, full command:
splunk edit licenser-localslave -master_uri https://YourLicenseMaster:8089
Answer C
Answer C Confirmed as per slide 14 of Cluster Administration PDF

questions.question_text: Search dashboards in the Monitoring Console indicate that the distributed deployment is approaching its capacity. Which of the following options will provide the most search performance improvement?

discussion.content: Yes D is the correct Answer

Selected Answer: D
most search performance issues can be addressed by adding search peers (indexers)

Selected Answer: C
Before adding more search peers, you should always try to optimize the scheduled searches first.
Architecting Splunk Enterprise Deployments p.145 - point 3

Selected Answer: C
Before adding more search peers, you should always try to optimize the scheduled searches first.
Architecting Splunk Enterprise Deployments p.145 - point 3

Selected Answer: D
Answer: D

Selected Answer: D
D is the correct answer
D is the correct Answer
D is the correct Answer

choices.A: Replace the indexer storage to solid state drives (SSD).
choices.D: Add more search peers and make sure forwarders distribute data evenly across all indexers.
choices.B: Add more search heads and redistribute users based on the search type.
choices.C: Look for slow searches and reschedule them to run during an off-peak time.

Answers C and D

questions.question_text: Splunk Enterprise platform instrumentation refers to data that the Splunk Enterprise deployment logs in the _introspection index. Which of the following logs are included in this index? (Select all that apply.)

choices.C: KV store listings, internal Splunk log files, search peer bundles listings, indexed data
choices.B: Server specs, current open connections, internal Splunk log files, index listings
choices.D: Splunk platform configuration details, Splunk users and their roles, current open connections, index listings
choices.A: Search history, Splunk users and their roles, running processes, indexed data

questions.question_text: Which of the following can a Splunk diag contain?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Server specs, current open connections, internal Splunk log files, index listings

Selected Answer: B
Answer B
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/Splunk/8.2.6/Troubleshooting/Generateadiag
in "About diag"
B is the one. Splunk diag will never collect personal data including: indexed data, user data, etc
